title: Classic Weightlifting & Strongman Legends
description: Flex your memory muscles and recall the mighty strongmen and weightlifting champions who inspired awe with their incredible feats of strength!

questions.question: Charles Atlas became famous through his comic book advertisements promising to help 'skinny guys' build muscles. What was his training method called?
Which bodybuilder won the Mr. Olympia title seven times and became a major movie star in the 1980s?
The 1977 documentary 'Pumping Iron' brought bodybuilding into mainstream culture and featured which two rivals?
Lou Ferrigno, who competed against Schwarzenegger, became famous for playing which TV superhero?
Which legendary American weightlifter won Olympic gold in 1948 and was known for his incredible pressing strength?
Paul Anderson, known as the 'World's Strongest Man' in the 1950s, won Olympic gold in which weight class at the 1956 Games?
Tommy Kono was a versatile Olympic weightlifter who won medals in three different weight classes. How many Olympic gold medals did he win?
Jack LaLanne, the fitness pioneer, hosted a television exercise show that ran from 1951 to 1985. What was he often called?
Which Soviet weightlifter, known as 'The Strongest Man in History,' set numerous world records in the 1960s-70s?
The Mr. Olympia competition, the most prestigious bodybuilding contest, was first held in what year?
Steve Reeves, a champion bodybuilder of the 1940s-50s, became a movie star playing which mythological hero?
Reg Park, who inspired a young Arnold Schwarzenegger, won the Mr. Universe title how many times?
The York Barbell Company, founded by Bob Hoffman, was the center of American weightlifting for decades. In which state was it located?
Which Cuban-born bodybuilder, known as 'The Myth,' won three consecutive Mr. Olympia titles from 1967 to 1969?
Joe Weider, along with his brother Ben, founded which bodybuilding organization that became the sport's governing body?
